Title: Sanwo-Olu gifts cars, N165.5m to public servants
Summary: Babajide Sanwo-Olu has rewarded 177 outstanding public servants in Lagos State with five brand new cars and N155.5 million . The governor also gave them the N165.5m and five new cars .

Title: Flinx Realty Limited: Building structures that strengthen communities and protect investors: Adigun Odunbaku
Summary: Nigeria’s urban growth needs not just new houses but also reliability, transparency, and a structure that can serve future generations . Flinx Realty Limited is building structures that strengthen communities and protect investors: Adunbaku .

Title: Poverty, high cost of living threaten livelihoods, TUC President warns
Summary: The Trade Union Congress of Nigeria (TUC) has warned that worsening poverty, rising inflation, and government policies prioritising austerity over people are pushing Nigerian workers and their families to the brink . TUC President-General, Festus Osifo, described the situation as a nightmare .

Title: How I won Ghana presidential election after Ooni’s prayers — Mahama
Summary: The Ooni of Ife, Oba Enitan Ogunwusi, conducted special prayers for John Mahama, the President of Ghana . Mahama said this shortly after he received the prestigious award of 2023 presidential election in Ghana .

Title: Panic grips Osun community as gunmen abduct ex-Customs officer, kill one
Summary: Fear has enveloped Ora, a community on the Osun–Kwara boundary, after gunmen stormed the community and abducted a retired Customs officer, Emmanuel Owolabi .

Title: Transcorp Hotels appoints Awele Elumelu as board chairperson
Summary: Dr. Elumelu’s appointment follows the retirement of the current Chair, Mr. Emmanuel Nnorom, with effect from January 01, 2026 .

Title: M23 militia says to pull out of key DR Congo city at US’s request
Summary: The M23's advance has thrown the future of the peace process into doubt . It has raised fears of a wider regional war . The future of peace process in DR Congo is in doubt .

Title: Tinted Glass Permit Enforcement: Call IGP to order, NBA tells Tinubu
Summary: Tinted Glass Permit Enforcement: Call IGP to order, NBA tells Tinubu . "The enforcement of the unlawful policy will initiate disorder and extortion," the NBA says . The NBA says the IGP has a history of extortion, bribery, harassment, intimidation and extrajudicial killings .

Title: Rivers: Tinubu can now rule Nigeria with military - Okonkwo faults Supreme Court verdict
Summary: Kenneth Okonkwo, a chieftain of the African Democratic Congress (ADC), has faulted the Supreme Court’s verdict on the emergency rule on Rivers State . President Bola Tinubu can now rule Nigeria with military, he said .

Title: Sanwo-Olu rewards 177 Lagos workers with five cars, N165.5m
Summary: Lagos State Government has recognised 177 outstanding public servants with five brand new cars and a total of N165.5 million in cash . The awards were presented by Governor Babajide Sanwo-Olu during the 2025 ‘Mr. Governor’s Luncheon’ at the Adeyemi Bero Auditorium, Al

Title: Kogi varsity gets new VC
Summary: The Governing Council of the Federal University, Lokoja, Kogi State, has approved the appointment of Professor Gbenga Ibileye as the institution’s fourth substantive Vice-Chancellor . Title: Why Buhari didn't sack underperforming ministers, aides - Aisha
Summary: Aisha Buhari says her late husband protected individuals who should have faced scrutiny . The former First Lady says advancing age and sensitivity to the “dictator’s label from the 1980s made him wary of being seen as ruthless . Title: Why I will not remarry after Buhari’s demise — Aisha
Summary: Aisha Buhari says she has no plans to remarry, describing the decision as pragmatic, not moralistic . The former First Lady says she plans a quieter public life, splitting her time between family, philanthropy and travel . Title: Yobe to use Muhammadu Buhari airport for 2026 Hajj
Summary: The Yobe Ministry of Transport and Energy has completed institutional engagements with key aviation agencies for transporting pilgrims from the Muhammadu Buhari International Cargo Airport, Damaturu, to Saudi Arabia for the 2026 hajj .
